references.paper_title: Conservative objective models for effective offline model-based optimization
references.reason: This paper introduces the COMs framework, which is central to the methodology of the current paper for mitigating adversarial designs in offline MBO.

references.paper_title: Model-driven generation of artificial yeast promoters
references.reason: This paper is a foundational work in automated promoter design using model-based optimization, providing a relevant comparison point for the current work's methodology.

references.paper_title: A generative neural network for maximizing fitness and diversity of synthetic DNA and protein sequences
references.reason: This paper introduces DENs, a generative model-based approach for sequence design which serves as a key baseline comparison to the current paper's proposed MBO workflow.

references.paper_title: Machine-guided design of cell-type-targeting cis-regulatory elements
references.reason: This paper is a contemporary work focusing on the design of cell-type-specific promoters using machine learning, providing a direct comparison to evaluate the proposed method's performance and data-efficiency.

references.paper_title: Modeling promoter-driven gene expression using transfer learning
references.reason: This paper details the transfer learning approach used in the current study for building accurate and data-efficient models of promoter-driven expression, providing essential context and technical background.
